headline: GIS Q2 Deep Dive: Investment in Value and Innovation Amid Volume and Margin Pressures
summary: Packaged foods company General Mills (NYSE:GIS) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales falling 3.3% year on year to $4.56 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.74 per share was 4.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Nestlé next to announce additive moves
summary: The Swiss giant is planning to remove colour additives in its food and drinks products on sale in the US "by mid-2026", the Nesquik owner said.

headline: Nestlé, Conagra next to announce additive moves
summary: Nestlé plans to remove colour additives in its US food and drinks products "by mid-2026", while Conagra is targeting the same for its frozen goods by the end of 2025.

headline: Morning Movers: General Mills dips following fourth quarter report
summary: Futures are flat to slightly higher as the Israel‑Iran ceasefire remains stable and investor focus shifts to another day of testimony from Fed Chair Powell. Oil prices have steadied around $65-$66 per barrel after a recent drop, easing inflation pressures and supporting equities. Treasury yields and the dollar have softened, buoyed by speculation that the Fed may cut rates as soon as July or September. headline: McCormick Backs Guidance After Reporting Higher Profit, Sales
summary: McCormick’s sales edged higher in its fiscal second quarter, while earnings beat Wall Street estimates. The maker of spices and seasonings also maintained its fiscal-year sales outlook.

raw.headline: McCormick Backs Guidance After Reporting Higher Profit, Sales
raw.summary: McCormick’s sales edged higher in its fiscal second quarter, while earnings beat Wall Street estimates. The maker of spices and seasonings also maintained its fiscal-year sales outlook.

headline: McCormick Stock Is Climbing. Spice Maker’s Earnings Beat Expectations.
summary: Shares of  McCormick & Company  were rising Thursday after the spices and seasonings maker posted quarterly earnings that were good enough for Wall Street’s taste.  The company reported adjusted earnings of 69 cents a share on net sales of $1.66 billion for its fiscal second quarter, narrowly above analysts’ consensus forecasts of 65 cents a share and sales of $1.658 billion.  McCormick  also reiterated its fiscal-year forecasts, which called for modest growth across key financial metrics.
